history.text: Hi! Have you seen this movie?
No, I have not.  It seems like it's not that great of a movie since it has such bad reviews.
I have seen a couple of the super hero movies but not this one.
It is not that old of a movie but it must have really bombed at the theaters.
The only actor I recognize on the list is Ben Affleck.
The critical responses seem pretty harse.  I don't think I would watch this movie.  How about you?
The cast looks great. I have seen all of the other actors in big movies.  Too bad they didn't get a script to work with.
Rotten Tomatoes really gave it a splat  I can usually trust them.
Yeah I agree.  I think they should have had Christian Bale play Batman.
I'm not even sure what this movie is supposed to be about.  Do they fight each other or fight together?
He was very good in that version. I don't think I would even watch this on TV.
From what I just read it sounds like they don't trust each other at all and are somewhat at odds.
This plot sounds really bad.  I don't like the idea of two super heroes existing in the same movie like this.
The backgrounds don't seem to flow too well.
I agree.  It doesn't make sense for Superman to become "controversial" and Batman teaming up to defeat him.
Batman technically doesn't have any super power like Superman does, so the match-up wouldn't really be fair or make any sense.  Batman only have technology and not super strength like Superman.
It does seem that they must at some point join up rather than be at odds with each other since Lex Luther is around.
Ok this clears it up a little.
It would have made more sense for them to team up and fight against Luther than for them to fight each other.
I think the script got too weighed down for kids to keep up with. Kipnapped parents and too super heros and villains.  Way too much for two hours.
It also doesn't explain how Lois escapes as she was originally kidnapped by Luther.  Seems like a plot hole to me.
I think there just seems to be too many characters.  It may have made a better book where people can take there time to read and follow the multiple plots.
I agree.  The movie title also doesn't make sense because Luther isn't mentioned and he's the real enemy in the movie.
Perhaps they should have made this into multiple movies to elaborate more on the story instead of making it all in just one movie.
I am sure they expected every one to be a fan and clamor to theaters.  True maybe two parts would have worked.
The ending sounds intriguing.  And finally superman is going to marry Lois!
Part of this really does sound like a good movie. I am sure that it is difficult to balance action and plot development.
It says that Superman died.  I'm guessing Lex Luthor killed him.  That seems like a bad ending in my opinion.
The ground moving at the end suggests that he will make a comeback for a sequel.
Oh then perhaps he faked his death and they will make another movie with him coming back to team up with Batman to take down Lex Luthor.
Hmmmmm maybe I would watch it on tv.
That would be an interesting plot if that's the case.
I would probably watch it on tv too if I had the time to.
What do you think? Would you take the 21/2 hours to watch it?
